info.name: MTN Customer Subscription Ghana API
info.description:
The Customer subscription API facilitates a customer to make new subscription and also view active and past subscriptions

**15-June-21: ChangeID: 0000000000**
  - Added OPT-IN and OPT-OUT enum values for subscribeType of the post the /customers/{customerId}/subscriptions endpoint. This is to enable activate/disactivate auto-renewal on an already existing subscription id
**23-Aug-20: ChangeID: 0000000012**
  - Added a new endpoint /customers/subscriptions/status/{statusId} to enable querying of transactions on ERS system

Contact Support:
 Name: MTN API Support
 Email: developer-support@mtn.com

item.name: List all Subscriptions with date range

header.description: Base64 encoding of 3rd party username and password
Client generated ID to include for tracing requests

url.raw: {{baseUrl}}/customers/:customerId/subscriptions/history?nodeId=do ut ullamco&startDate=do ut ullamco&endDate=do ut ullamco&pageNo=1&limit=All result&subscriptionProviderId=do ut ullamco&filterResponseById=false

query.description: Third parties unique identifier. Can also be called channelId.
List all Subscriptions from the stated date. While computing subscription history if start and endDate is not inputted the startDate is 3 months from today and the endDate is today.
List all Subscriptions till the provided endDate id it is not provided then today is used
Current Page
Limit the list of results returned by an API. Optional, If its not specified we should return all the values.
For the application to return product history tied to the requesting channel alone. This is applicable for only request to HSDP backend system

item.name: Get provisioning status of a recently added Subscription

query.description: This is used to match the statusId value to either a referenceId or a sequence

request.description: For certain provisioning requests to add a new subscription, the response will be asynchronous, with a status of PENDING. Use this query to poll the final status of the provisioning, using the transactionID that was used for the original provisioning request.
